description:
We are gearing up for another week of culinary bliss during Ann Arbor's summer Restaurant Week! 

We are featuring these special menus available in addition to our regular menu all week long.  
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Summer Restaurant Week 2016
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Two for $15 lunch
Tax and gratuity not included
•	Choose one entrée for each person
o	BBQ Tofu Sandwich
o	Whitefish Po-boy
o	Chicken BLT
o	Caesar Salad
o	Cherry Almond Salad
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Two for $28 dinner per person
Tax and gratuity not included

Appetizer
To share, please choose one
•	Fried Pickle Spears 
•	Truffle Sprouts
•	Hummus and Pita 

Entree
Each guest chooses one entree
•	Mac and Cheese
•	Fish and Chips
•	Urban Cowboy Bean Burger
•	Ar-burger

Dessert or Beer
To share, please choose one
•	Stout Chocolate pudding cake
•	Strawberries and Cream Belgian waffle
•	Maple Bourbon Bread Pudding

Not interested in dessert? Swap it out for your choice of two 16oz drafts
name: Restaurant Week

description:
Did you know that babo now offers craft cocktails along with craft beer and various varietals of wine?

Every Monday through Friday we will be offering 20% off our signature cocktails, draft beers, and wine by the glass for Happy Hour.

So take this time to Treat yo' self!
name: Happy Hour at babo

description:
Literati is delighted to welcome staff-favorite Rebecca Makkai - Author in support of Music for Wartime! Rebecca will be joined in conversation by Whiting Award-winning author Michael Byers. 

Music for Wartime is a collection of short stories with intelligence, wit, and heart. A reality show producer manipulates two contestants into falling in love, while her own relationship falls apart. Just after the fall of the Berlin Wall, a young boy has a revelation about his father’s past when a renowned Romanian violinist plays a concert in their home. In an unnamed country, a composer records the folk songs of two women from a village on the brink of destruction. Ranging from comedy to tragedy to the surreal, from the world of academia to war zones, these fifteen stories ask the question of what it means to be an artist in a brutal and sometimes ugly world.

“Though these stories alternate in time between WWII and the present day, they all are set, as described in the story “Exposition,” within “the borders of the human heart”—a terrain that their author maps uncommonly well.” — Publisher’s Weekly, starred and featured review

Rebecca Makkai is the Chicago-based author of the novels The Hundred-Year House, winner of the Chicago Writers Association’s Novel of the Year award, and The Borrower, a Booklist Top Ten Debut which has been translated into eight languages. Her short fiction was chosen for The Best American Short Stories for four consecutive years (2011, 2010, 2009 and 2008), and appears regularly in journals like Harper’s, Tin House, and New England Review. The recipient of a 2014 NEA fellowship, Makkai will be visiting faculty this fall at the Iowa Writers’ Workshop.

Michael Byers is the author of The Coast of Good Intentions, which was a finalist for the PEN/Hemingway Award and won the Sue Kaufman Prize from the American Academy of Arts and Letters; Long for This World, which won the annual fiction prize from Friends of American Writers; and the acclaimed novel Percival's Planet. Byers’ fiction has appeared in Best American Short Stories and Prize Stories: The O. Henry Awards; his nonfiction has appeared in The New York Times, The Wall Street Journal, The Washington Post, Best American Travel Writing, and elsewhere. A former Stegner Fellow at Stanford, he teaches creative writing at the University of Michigan.

Viking Books
name: Rebecca Makkai

description:
Are you interested in learning more about how to care for our natural areas? Then join the Stewardship Network's Huron Arbor cluster for an informal discussion on a monthly topic with volunteer and professional land stewards, plus others interested in nature. Free! 
This month’s topic: Join staff and representatives of the Huron-Arbor Cluster for a lively discussion of ongoing programs and new opportunities at the Stewardship Network. Topics will range from the Garlic Mustard Challenge to new TSN staff in Clusters across the Great Lakes and New England!
name: Stewards' Circle- The Stewardship Network

description:
Your favorite dinner spot just became your favorite lunch spot.
Bringing great food, and quick service to your lunch break. Offering paella for two, Spanish flatbreads, salads, and more!
Check out the new menu with the link listed above.
name: Aventura Spring Menu Launch

description:
NEW SPRING MENUS!

New season, new Menu. Introducing new menu items that are seasonally fresh, bright, and delicious!

Bringing all things spring to the table, with new colorful and locally sourced food and beverage options.

MAKE A RESERVATION
Click link listed in "Tickets Available"
name: New Spring Cocktail & Dinner Menus

description:
Arbor Brewing Company presents...
ACOUSTIC TUESDAYS!
Every Tuesday at 7pm, we’ll be featuring live acoustic sets from the area’s most talented artists.

-June 14 Jon Ponder Trio

Based in Ann Arbor, Michigan, Jon Ponder is a singer/songwriter and a librarian with a passion for preserving and telling good stories. Using acoustic roots instrumentation and styles that range from old-time string band music to country to Americana folk and folk-rock, Jon writes songs with memorable melodies, clear images, and stories that take listeners to specific times, places, and experiences. For this performance, Jon will be joined by Eric Anderson on banjo and mandolin and Azalea Grace on harmony vocals


Never a cover
Always a good time
name: Acoustic Tuesdays: Jon Ponder Trio

description:
Restaurant Week is your opportunity to try as many great Ann Arbor restaurants as your schedule allows for one incredibly low fixed price. $28 for a three course dinner! 

The Main Street Area Association (Main Street Area Ann Arbor) is proud to bring you Ann Arbor's favorite semi-annual dining event - Restaurant Week!
The specials run June 12-17th. Visit www.annarborrestaurantweek.com for details.
name: Ann Arbor Restaurant Week
